image.altText: Giant panda Fu Ni

props.synopsis: While cuddly duo Wang Wang and Fu Ni will soon be set to return home to China, Adelaide Zoo is adamant that the pandas' love affair with the public has fulfilled predictions from prior to their arrival.

title.children: Australia's pandas may not have mated, but have enjoyed a love affair with the public

image.altText: a nuclear generating station can be seen with water infront of it.

props.synopsis: Coalition promises that nuclear power will make for cheaper electricity prices don't stack up, according to an energy analyst, who says there was no evidence anywhere in the developed world to suggest new reactors were pushing down prices.

title.children: 'An absolute stretch': Dutton's promise nuclear will make for cheaper power questioned

image.altText: A group of politicians in suits walk together.

props.synopsis: State premiers make themselves another hurdle for the federal Coalition to clear if it wants to introduce nuclear power plants at seven locations across the country, saying they would not cooperate to lift state-level nuclear bans.

title.children: Premiers threaten to derail proposal for seven nuclear reactors, saying Dutton has no power to lift state bans

image.altText: Two people outside an Adelaide court.

props.synopsis: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle loses his appeal to secure immunity from prosecution under protection laws in South Australia's Supreme Court.

title.children: ATO whistleblower's appeal for immunity dismissed — but reasons suppressed for now

image.altText: Troy Bell walks past the court building.

props.synopsis: The defence lawyer for Independent MP Troy Bell says the politician denies allegations he stole funds intended to support students who had disengaged from mainstream schools.

title.children: Fraud allegations levelled against Independent MP Troy Bell 'much ado about nothing', court hears

image.altText: A man gets stopped by security on an oval pitch.

props.synopsis: Julian Saginario, who pleaded guilty to running onto Adelaide Oval during a match between the Adelaide Crows and Geelong Cats, has been fined $1,080 in the Adelaide Magistrates Court.

title.children: 'Troublemaker' pitch invader fined for interrupting AFL match at Adelaide Oval

image.altText: A black shopping basket sitting on a kitchen bench that contains bread, mince, carrots, apples and milk.

props.synopsis: Australians have few options when it comes to saving on groceries at supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths, with a new report by Choice finding a price difference of just 75 cents between the two for the same basic items.

title.children: Is Coles or Woolworths cheaper? New data shows there's only a 75-cent gap

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock at press conference

props.synopsis: Rate rise after rate rise should have sent the economy into a tailspin, but the RBA isn't fighting a textbook case of inflation.

title.children: What's driving our inflation? And would more rate rises fix the problems?

image.altText: Two nuclear power buildings in the night.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has put its cards on the table, unveiling its plan to build nuclear plants to secure Australia's energy future. But one thing was missing — what will it cost?

title.children: With battle lines drawn over who can deliver clean, cheap energy, one key question remains

image.altText: Two investigators speaking near a police car with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 31-year-old man they believe is linked to a woman's death that caused an emergency declaration that shut down parts of South Mackay.

title.children: Man arrested following manhunt after a woman was shot dead

image.altText: Two people sit alongside one another with sleeping bags.

props.synopsis: This year's annual homelessness fundraiser in which SA business and community leaders sleep rough for one night has a deeply personal relevance for Angelique Boileau, whose mother was imprisoned in post-war Hungary.

title.children: Sleepout fundraiser amid 'new wave of homelessness' is a cause close to home for this executive

image.altText: A small dog sits in a driver's lap in a car while the driver scrolls on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: South Australian drivers will be given a three-month "educational period" as new mobile phone detection cameras are officially switched on.

title.children: New mobile phone detection cameras to catch distracted drivers on busy Adelaide roads

image.altText: A man in a jacket and tie.

props.synopsis: Allegations that a senior South Australian police officer, who was leading a program to combat sexual harassment, sexually assaulted a female colleague at a social function have been made under parliamentary privilege.

title.children: 'Worst-kept secret': Allegations senior police officer sexually assaulted female colleague aired in parliament

image.altText: Houses and construction material on the ground viewed through ripped packaging

props.synopsis: A leading industry group warns SA Water's inability to provide approvals and connections will compound the housing supply woes South Australia is experiencing.

title.children: Housing industry warns of 'valley of death' as SA Water cuts approvals for new homes

image.altText: A dachshund wearing a pink harness stands between a person's legs, looking to the left

props.synopsis: Pet ownership can offer a wealth of positives for many people, but for those experiencing homelessness, the costs can be insurmountable.

title.children: 'They still mean the world to these owners': Meet the volunteers helping care for Australia's homeless pets

image.altText: three women in colourful urban wear and black hijabs stand confidently against a black background.

props.synopsis: Voice of Baceprot are a devoutly Muslim all-female thrash metal band hell-bent on shattering the genre's masculine image and misconceptions about Islam.

title.children: Indonesian Muslim metal band Voice of Baceprot take peaceful brand of thrash metal to Glastonbury

image.altText: A man and a woman embrace in a hospital room.

props.synopsis: After months of being held captive by Hamas, Almog Meir Jan wondered if he'd been forgotten. Then he saw himself on his guards' television.

title.children: Hamas guards told Almog that Israel didn't care about him. Then he saw his face on TV

image.altText: A close up of James Marape wearing a red tie and dark blue suit at a podium infront of a crowd.

props.synopsis: Australia announces a new program to help Papua New Guinea improve its weapons management as part of a series of initiatives aimed at strengthening the country's internal security.

title.children: 'It reflects who we are to one another': Australia announces initiatives to improve PNG internal security, law and justice

image.altText: Screengrab of a grey-haired man being wrestled into a car by a few policeman

props.synopsis: More than three decades after Jack Karlson's infamous arrest at a Chinese restaurant in Brisbane captured the nation, a film crew is setting out to document his life.

title.children: Prison escapee behind famous meme 'a succulent Chinese meal' shares lunch with arresting officer 32 years later

image.altText: Jerry Seinfeld

props.synopsis: Footage shows security escorting a couple of people out of a Jerry Seinfeld show in Sydney. The American comedian has been vocal in his support for Israel since October 7.

title.children: Second Jerry Seinfeld Sydney show interrupted by pro-Palestinian protesters

image.altText: A man in a brown sweater, a black beanie and denim jeans stands in front of children's car toys.

props.synopsis: While international ecommerce offers cheap prices, there are fears the online giants are contributing to a culture of over-consumption by shoppers — and killing off traditional toy stores.

title.children: With the rise of ecommerce websites, kids' toyshops may become a thing of the past

image.altText: two women standing together in their underwear

props.synopsis: Almost one quarter of people aged 18 to 24 feel anxious or embarrassed about their genital appearance, new research shows, so what are our labia actually supposed to look like?

title.children: 'I'd never seen anyone with labia like mine': Celebrating labia diversity to combat growing anxiety

image.altText: Professional swimmer screaming in pain after dislocating his shoulder in the pool

props.synopsis: French swimmer Rafael Fente-Damers pulled out the swim of his life to qualify for his home Olympic Games, but now he'll have to wait on the results of scans after appearing to dislocate his shoulder celebrating.

title.children: From joy to agony: How a 'crazy' French swimmer put his Olympics hopes in jeopardy by celebrating

image.altText: The outside of a modern court building in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A District Court jury has heard three women were allegedly gang-raped by three men during a bucks weekend in Newcastle.

title.children: Trio face trial accused of bucks party gang rapes

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: A man representing himself while accused of assaulting his former partner and splashing acid on four police officers is challenged when he says he is going to leave court because the evidence is "too distressing".

title.children: 'You're not allowed to leave': 'Diplomat Dan' challenged in courtroom as pre-siege CCTV played

image.altText: Sam Taylor is concentrating on something

props.synopsis: GWS star Sam Taylor, heralded by many as the best defender in the AFL, faces an indefinite period on the sidelines after rupturing a testicle during the Giants' game against Port Adelaide.

title.children: Giants star Sam Taylor out indefinitely after rupturing testicle

image.altText: Peter Dutton nuclear graphic

props.synopsis: Teased and speculated for more than two years, Peter Dutton has finally revealed his nuclear power policy.

title.children: Why has the Coalition gone nuclear? The facts you need to navigate the energy debate

image.altText: Peter Dutton during QT

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's nuclear energy plan is one of the riskiest gambits from opposition in many moons. He genuinely believes nuclear is the answer to Australia's energy problems, but it remains to be seen whether the details will vindicate his conviction.

title.children: Peter Dutton has placed a staggering bet on his ability to sell Australians nuclear power — it's a huge gamble

image.altText: A smiling lady in a pink hat and top waves her hands as she stands in crowd in bright sun outside Federal Parliament.

props.synopsis: Under the new arrangement announced by Chinese Premier Li Qiang, Australians will be able to travel to China for up to 15 days without the need to apply and pay for a visa, and for those looking to visit family the plan has been well received even though many details are still to emerge.

title.children: Visa-free travel for short trips to China will save Australians time and money but not everyone is happy

image.altText: A composite image of a young man with a shaved face, and an older man with a very bushy beard.

props.synopsis: Dubbed "photosynthesis in human form", beloved gardening presenter Costa Georgiadis will be the inspiration for amateur and professional artists all over the country this year.

title.children: To beard or not to beard? Artists face dilemma as Costa is named this year's Bradley portrait competition muse

image.altText: A dusting of snow covers the rocks at cradle mountain

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia have woken to their coldest morning of the year over the last two days, and the 'feels-like' temperature has been even more chilly. Here's why.

title.children: Icy blast adds extra chill to Australia's east as BOM reveals 'feels-like' temperature formula

image.altText: a man in a wheelchair sits beside a Tesla

props.synopsis: Darren waits "hours and hours and hours" for taxis in Queensland, and hopes self-driving cars might be the answer. But an unpredictable marsupial is standing in the way.

title.children: Self-driving cars a 'game changer' for disabled Aussies, but they've got a kangaroo problem

image.altText: Regan Smith holds up her hand

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown goes from hunted to hunter at Paris 2024 Games after Regan Smith smashes her 100m backstroke world record at the US Olympic Trials.

title.children: Regan Smith smashes Kaylee McKeown's 100m backstroke world record

image.altText: Kayaker Jessica Fox celebrates by clapping her hands, in the kayak, in the water and the end of the course

props.synopsis: Jess Fox set another benchmark in paddle sport history by winning all three World Cup events, but it came at the end of an emotional rollercoaster of a week that saw incredible highs of Noemie's Olympic qualification, and the devastating lows of losing her grandfather.

title.children: 'One of the best days of my life': Jess Fox's emotional week highlighted by sister Noemie's Olympic qualification
